abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated satisfactory,
            though sustainability is unlikely, and institutional
            development impacts were modest. Performance ratings gave
            mixed results, for while the Bank's lending performance
            was satisfactory, its overall performance is rated
            unsatisfactory due to the lack of flexible, and proactive
            supervision, which should have adapted to the country's
            changing circumstances. Conversely, overall borrower
            performance is assessed as marginally satisfactory, namely
            due to personnel factors, which hindered implementation.
            Lessons address the need for more proactive approaches in
            light of weak component performance, stressing project
            restructuring as a way to deal with emerging realities.
            Moreover, the extremely limited budgetary resources in the
            country should have raised substantial questions on the
            sustainability of project components, placing greater
            emphasis during project design, and execution, on the
            sustainability of benefits considering the uncertain
            macroeconomic climate. In addition, the absence of linkages
            to adjustment operations, and no mechanisms for
            conditionality precluded policy, and structural reform;
            whereas an analysis of existing policy and structural
            weaknesses, could have linked the approach taken in each
            component, to ongoing improvements in policy framework.
            Although the independence of the Project Unit somehow eased
            procurement, rigorous procurement plans should have been developed.
